description:
I am not sure if this is a bug but I don't think its a correct behaviour.
when I create a snapshot type image from a running instance, the livirt will be killed and restarted: 

[root@cougar07 ~(keystone_admin)]# virsh -r list 
 Id    Name                           State
----------------------------------------------------
 12    instance-00000036              running

[root@cougar07 ~(keystone_admin)]# virsh -r list 
 Id    Name                           State
----------------------------------------------------

[root@cougar07 ~(keystone_admin)]# virsh -r list 
 Id    Name                           State
----------------------------------------------------

[root@cougar07 ~(keystone_admin)]# virsh -r list 
 Id    Name                           State
----------------------------------------------------
 13    instance-00000036              shut off

[root@cougar07 ~(keystone_admin)]# virsh -r list 
 Id    Name                           State
----------------------------------------------------
 13    instance-00000036              running
title: libvirt instance is killed and restarted during create snapshot for instance

comments.content: When using cold snapshots nova will stop the instance while copying the disk and bring it back once done. This is the normal behaviour and won't happen if your system is capable of doing live snapshots (qemu >= 1.3.0 and libvirt >= 1.0.0).
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~xqueralt-deactivatedaccount

comments.content:
If I look at latest rhevm3.2 and 3.3 which supports live snapshots, these are the packages that were released with it for libvirt and qemu: 

QEMU-KVM-RHEV:  0.12.1.2-2.355.el6_4.3
LIBVIRT:                   0.10.2-18.el6_4.9

my setup is running the below: 

qemu-img-rhev-0.12.1.2-2.413.el6.x86_64
qemu-kvm-rhev-0.12.1.2-2.413.el6.x86_64
libvirt-0.10.2-27.el6.x86_64

if my setup's packages are a few versions more advanced than rhevm's than they should support live snapshots and so no reason for the instances to be stopped. 

I think this bug is valid - lets discuss this please.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dron-3
